page.title: 07THE A4 THEALE
page.content: Until the M4 and the Theale by-pass were built the main street through Theale was the A4 which carried much of the east-west traffic in central-southern England. 95 vehicles entered the A4(Theale) from the roundabout. 20 had come from the Theale by-pass, 8 from Wigmore Lane, 27 from the A4(Thatcham, 24 from the A340 and 16 had gone once round the roundabout. 44 vehicles went onto the roundabout from the A4(Theale). 11 went to the Theale by-pass, 2 to Wigmore Lane, 13 to the A4(Thatcham), 2 to the A340 and 16 had gone once round the roundabout. Most of the vehicles going once round the roundabout were coaches from Smith's Commercial Vehicle Repairs. Few vehicles use the roundabout as there is easier access to the M4 and Reading at the eastern end of the village.
